title: Condensed Caps, Angled Terminals
content:
Hello All -

Here’s a mysterious sample. A set of condensed capitals used on Underoath’s Survive Kaleidoscope album. The image is small, and doesn’t quite capture the types strange slanted terminals. It’s almost like an extrusion or a jackboot fraktur.

Thanks for any ideas, and if I dig up more complete images I’ll add them.

- Reed

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [tall\_skinny.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20090826112054/http:/typophile.com/files/tall_skinny.jpg) | 17.21 KB |
author: taprootconcept

comments.content:
Alternate Gothic,

What you seeing is not featuring any stylistic affectation per se—just used that way. The “O” is actually Ø used in Norwegian languages and some (many ?) others.

The Bitstream version seems to have the best kerning:  
 [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/alternate-gothic/](http://web.archive.org/web/20090826112054/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/alternate-gothic/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/alternate-gothic/")

Mikey :-)
